Articles.Content:
Hello to everyone.

Playing with Orbital Science, I was finally able to assemble in orbit, Cyclotron and Lab. To have the more practice station for docking of multiple ship, I created in hub with 5 docking port and I put it in the center of station. So I separated Cyclotron and Lab again, I docked the hub to the lab, and when finally I redocked the Cyclotron, the station begins to flex more and more, also with Sas and Rcs on, until it exploded...

Probably I was wrong with something, but what was?

Thanks for any help

Kracken attack!

but in all seriousness. It is due to a bug in ksp.

nothing I can help you

EDIT:

also sometimes sas and rcs go weird in ksp.

Edited January 11, 2015 by Joshwoo69
noting wait what?

If you turn the warp speed up a click (which will stop the flexing) and then back down, that will hopefully help the station settle down. I'm currently piecing my first station together and have had a few bumpy moments as well.
Thanks for the suggestions, I didn't know about this bug...

Moved to Support (unmodded installs). Unless I'm very much mistaken, this is a stock bug that appears to be related to docking & part clipping. It's usually not possible to save the vessel, unless you can undock the parts that are causing the issue.
